translation:
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

Herewith I send to Your Excellency Lieutenant José Alves de Medeiros, interim commander of the Triunfo Squadron, the death of the assassin Farias, which greatly benefits humanity with the death of such a villain; yesterday I received word that he had descended to the Triunfo pass with a scoundrel; at night I sent a detachment to ambush on his retreat path, not only to capture him, but also to seize some deserters from the corps. This detachment has not yet returned.

This is all I have to bring to Your Excellency’s attention

whom God keep for many years. Encampment at Ponta Rasa, December 27, 1842. Francisco Pedro de Abreu Lieutenant Colonel.

Seen by His Excellency December 28, 1842. Order of the day nº 12 of the 31st of the said month.

For order of the day, the case of the death of Faria.
